Executive Summary: Independent MBS publisher focused on transforming, enlightening books. Ancient Greek 'hierophant' means interpreter of sacred mysteries.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Plant Spirit Herbalism by Katie Kukwa (Oct 2024); Shakespeare's Guide to Living the Good Life (Jan 2025); Intuitive Astrology Book 2 by Molly McCord (2024)
Notable Authors: Katie Kukwa, Molly McCord, don Miguel Ruiz Jr.
Outreach Notes: Small press, no audio program. Perfect ICP fit. Personal growth niche.

Executive Summary: Premier publisher of business content for colleges and universities since 2008. Precise business info written by experts. 30+ collections, 900+ books.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Business leadership series, Management collections, MBA coursework titles
Notable Authors: Academic business experts, MBA faculty, industry practitioners
Outreach Notes: Academic focus perfect for professional audiobooks. Contact Scott Isenberg or Rob Zwettler (Exec Acquisitions Editor).

Executive Summary: Family-owned since 1994. Focus on consumer health titles used by hospitals, clinics, and state health departments. IPG distribution.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Health titles for plastic surgeons, ophthalmologists, cardiologists; Divorce by State series (new 2024)
Notable Authors: Dozens of doctors including specialists in all medical fields
Outreach Notes: Excellent health niche. Books used by medical professionals. No postal mail queries since Sept 2024.

Genres/Focus: Literary translations, world literature, experimental fiction
Executive Summary: Largest US publisher of literature in translation. Nonprofit founded 2013. Founder was knighted by French government 2024. Acquired Open Letter Books 2025.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Little Seed by Wei Tchou (NYer Best Books 2024); Recital of the Dark Verses (2024 Queen Sofia Prize); Trash (World Lit Today Discovery Prize)
Notable Authors: Jon Fosse (2023 Nobel), Mikhail Shishkin, Anne Garr√©ta, Carmen Boullosa, Sergio Pitol
Outreach Notes: World-class literary press. Translation focus offers unique audiobook opportunity. 1500+ books from 100 languages.

Genres/Focus: Diverse voices, LGBTQ+, women, thought leadership
Executive Summary: Hybrid publisher elevating voices excluded from traditional publishing. LGBTQ+ and women-owned B Corporation. Amazon bestselling authors.
Recent Books (2024-2025): A Royal Commitment by Prince Manvendra (2024); Leadership Types by Laura Barnard (Oct 2024); The SAFE Leader by Dr. Mark McBride (May 2024); Your Queer Career by Dr. Steve Yacovelli (Mar 2024)
Notable Authors: Prince Manvendra, Laura Barnard, Dr. Mark McBride, Dr. Steve Yacovelli, Tony Ferraiolo
Outreach Notes: Certified B Corp. LGBTQ+ niche. Hybrid model = authors may fund audiobook. Diverse content perfect for audio.

Executive Summary: Dedicated to publishing reliable health/wellness content. Books, DVDs, digital products. Distributed by Penguin Random House Distribution Services.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Living with chronic diseases, fitness/exercise guides, sustainable living titles
Notable Authors: Health and wellness practitioners, fitness experts
Outreach Notes: PRH distribution but no audiobooks. Perfect health/wellness niche. Email ideas@hatherleighpress.com for submissions.

Genres/Focus: Literary fiction, memoir, true crime, social concern
Executive Summary: Founded 2001 by former literary agent. 80+ titles dealing with humanitarian issues. Distributed by Baker & Taylor Publisher Services.
Recent Books (2024-2025): California Medieval by Dianne Dugaw (Oct 2024 - NSA winner); The Oud Player of Cairo by Jasmin Attia (2023)
Notable Authors: Dianne Dugaw, Jasmin Attia, Sean Murphy (Senior Editor)
Outreach Notes: Small literary press. 'Our door is open' - accessible. Query via email. 60K-100K word manuscripts. Social concern themes.

Executive Summary: World-leading dark fiction publisher since 2012. Bram Stoker Award wins. Now entertainment company with multiple imprints including comics, games, kids.
Recent Books (2024-2025): The Bed Makers by Chad Lutzke (Feb 2024); The Devil's Backbone (Feb 2024); Dastardly Damsels ed. by Suzie Lockhart (Oct 2024)
Notable Authors: Stephen King, John Connolly, Christopher Golden, Ramsey Campbell, Jonathan Maberry
Outreach Notes: Sara Garcia is Editor-in-Chief. Horror niche exploding in audio. Multiple Bram Stoker Awards. Contact joe@crystallakepub.com.

Genres/Focus: Health, nutrition, chronic disease, self-care, caregiving
Executive Summary: Family-owned since 1972. Pioneer in stress management, obesity, cancer, children's nutrition trade books. Jim Bull took over from father David in 1994.
Recent Books (2024-2025): Living a Healthy Life with Chronic Conditions 5th Ed; Working With Worry by Dr. Samantha Sweeney; The Last Things We Talk About by Elizabeth Boatwright
Notable Authors: Dr. Samantha Sweeney, Miriam Erick MS RD, Liz Crocker, Bev Johnson
Outreach Notes: Emily Sewell is CFO (since 2001). Erin Mulligan handles editorial. Health niche with chronic disease focus. Perfect for audio.

Executive Summary: Founded from Findhorn Foundation spiritual community. Acquired by Inner Traditions 2018. 3 imprints: Findhorn, Camino Guides, Earthdancer.

Notable Authors: Diana Cooper, Carl Greer, Margaret Ann Lembo, Stewart Pearce, Allan Hunter
Outreach Notes: Now part of Inner Traditions family. Contact via innertraditions.com/publish. MBS niche perfect for audio meditation/healing content.

Executive Summary: Nonprofit literary publisher since 1976. 300+ books. Multiple prestigious awards including James Laughlin Awards, Lambda, Whiting, Lenore Marshall Prize.

Genres/Focus: Asian culture, cookbooks, martial arts, origami, language
Executive Summary: Premier publisher of English books on Asian culture since 1948. Part of Periplus Publishing Group. 6000+ backlist titles. Offices in VT, Singapore, Tokyo.

Notable Authors: Asian culture experts, martial arts masters, Japanese cuisine chefs
Outreach Notes: Noriko Netsu is Senior Editor. Accepts unagented submissions. Huge backlist = massive audiobook opportunity. Contact (800) 526-2778.

Executive Summary: Independent children's publisher since 1989. High-quality diverse content for children and young adults. Move Books imprint for diverse middle-grade.

Executive Summary: Nonprofit founded 1972. Specializes in experimental and genre-defying literature. 300+ books published, 250+ in print.

Executive Summary: Founded 2000. Fantasy and literary fiction. Also publishes Lady Churchill's Rosebud Wristlet. NOTE: Currently for sale as of 2025; closed to submissions since March 2023.
